Author: tholin
Content: STA is really annoying me right now. Its reporting setup violations in the 100ns violations because an active design might change the output-enable or pull resistors or something on a IO pad, which triggers a change in the pad’s outputs to the core area, which kicks of timing paths through unrelated designs, which may also change output enables which changes pad outputs which triggers changes through the designs etc. etc. and so on. It "bounces" like that for up to 5 times before coming to a stop.

Author: tholin
Content: I need STA to disregard ANY timing paths that cross macro boundaries except the multiplexer.

Author: tholin
Content: Only one of these will ever be active at a time and it doesn’t get that.

Author: tholin
Content: I could disable STA or STA checker entirely since the setup timing analysis results are largely meaningless anyway in my use case (every design has its own fmax), but I’d like the flow to fail on hold violations.

Author: tholin
Content: I’d like to ignore just setup violations, but still fail on hold violations.

Author: tholin
Content: I tried `set_false_path -from [get_ports {io_oe_.*}]` and so on, but no luck.
